question: Which of the following diseases is spread through cow’s milk?
explanation:
• Diphtheria is an infection caused by the Corynebacterium diphtheriae bacterium. Diphtheria spreads from person to person, usually through respiratory droplets, like from coughing or sneezing.
• Typhoid is water borne disease.
• Measles is caused by infection with the rubeola virus. The virus lives in the mucus of the nose and throat of an infected child or adult.
